meanings.definition: To move jerkily or with a jolting motion.
meanings.sent1: The old car hotches along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: She hotches when she tries to dance in high heels.
meanings.sent3: The robot hotches around the room, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: His heart hotches with excitement as he nears the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy hotches sadly on the shelf, unable to move smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The sudden hotches of the train made her spill her drink.
meanings.sent2: He felt the hotches of the rollercoaster as it climbed the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The hotches of the old swing brought back childhood memories.
meanings.sent4: The hotches of the earthquake shook the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The hotches of the boat on the rough sea made him feel queasy.
